title: How to Make Chicken and Bacon Stuffed Pancakes

steps.headline: Sprinkle a tablespoon of oil on a large saucepan.
Put the heat on to medium and fry the chicken breasts for about five to eight minutes.
steps.description: Cook until the chicken is golden brown.

steps.headline: Transfer the chicken onto a plate.
Cook and fry the bacon lardons for about five to seven minutes, until they are crispy and brown.
steps.description: Transfer and place the lardons next to the chicken breasts.

steps.headline: Add more oil to the pan and cook the mushrooms and onions.
steps.description: Cook for about five to ten minutes, until the mushrooms are soft and the onions are lightly crisped.

steps.headline: Mix in the flour and stir with a whisk to form a paste into the mixture.
Pour in the milk and whisk until well-combined.
Have the mixture bubble for about two to three minutes until it is thick.
Chop the chicken into small pieces and add it to the mixture, as well as the lardons.
Fold in the parsley and mix.
Set aside and allow the mixture to cool.
Make the pancake batter.
steps.description: Mix the dry ingredient into a large bowl and then pour in the wet ingredients. Stir well with a whisk. There will be some lumps.

steps.headline: Cook the pancakes.
steps.description: Scoop the pancake batter with a ladle and pour it onto a hot pan. Cook the pancakes on both sides until each side is golden brown.

steps.headline: Transfer the pancakes onto a plate.
Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 Celsius).
Assemble the pancakes.
steps.description: Stuff the pancakes with the chicken and bacon mixture. Brush the pancakes with a beaten egg and sprinkle the breadcrumbs over it.

steps.headline: Bake the pancakes for about 20-25 minutes, until the pancakes are crispy and golden brown.
Serve.
steps.description: Transfer the pancakes to a plate. Serve with a salad, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Sprinkle a tablespoon of oil on a large saucepan.  Put the heat on to medium and fry the chicken breasts for about five to eight minutes. Cook until the chicken is golden brown. Transfer the chicken onto a plate.  Cook and fry the bacon lardons for about five to seven minutes, until they are crispy and brown. Transfer and place the lardons next to the chicken breasts. Add more oil to the pan and cook the mushrooms and onions. Cook for about five to ten minutes, until the mushrooms are soft and the onions are lightly crisped. Mix in the flour and stir with a whisk to form a paste into the mixture.  Pour in the milk and whisk until well-combined.  Have the mixture bubble for about two to three minutes until it is thick.  Chop the chicken into small pieces and add it to the mixture, as well as the lardons.  Fold in the parsley and mix.  Set aside and allow the mixture to cool.  Make the pancake batter. Mix the dry ingredient into a large bowl and then pour in the wet ingredients. Stir well with a whisk. There will be some lumps. Cook the pancakes. Scoop the pancake batter with a ladle and pour it onto a hot pan. Cook the pancakes on both sides until each side is golden brown. Transfer the pancakes onto a plate.  Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190 Celsius).  Assemble the pancakes. Stuff the pancakes with the chicken and bacon mixture. Brush the pancakes with a beaten egg and sprinkle the breadcrumbs over it. Bake the pancakes for about 20-25 minutes, until the pancakes are crispy and golden brown.  Serve. Transfer the pancakes to a plate. Serve with a salad, if desired. Enjoy!
